content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

The countries of Durbeville and Garmaston experienced the economic conditions in the tables below.

Durbeville

Garmaston

<math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="105" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>105</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="$210" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>210</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="110" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>110</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="$220" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>220</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Calculate each of the following for Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.(i) Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita for Durbeville(ii) Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> per capita for Garmaston

(b) If Durbeville and Garmaston have the same velocity of money in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which country must have the higher money supply in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Explain.

(c) Calculate each of the following in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Show your work.(i) The inflation rate in Durbeville(ii) The inflation rate in Garmaston

(d) Based on your answer to part (c), if the nominal interest rate is the same for both countries in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, which country experiences the higher real interest rate in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ? Explain.

(e) Based on your answer to part (c)(ii), if the expected inflation rate in Garmaston in Year <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> was <math alttext="12%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, what would be the effect on real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> as the economy adjusts to its long-run equilibrium? Explain.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.

frqParts.text: Respond to all parts of the question.

unit.text: 2: Economic Indicators and the Business Cycle

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
